hero.title: Quantum Computing Breakthrough: IBM and Google Close the Gap
hero.intro: Researchers have achieved a record 1,000-qubit threshold with error correction, bringing us one step closer to a cryptographically relevant quantum computer. The implications for financial modeling and cryptosecurity are profound, marking a new chapter in computational finance.
hero.author: Alex Thorne
hero.contentLeft: The achievement represents a 10x increase in reliable qubit density compared to last year's benchmarks.
hero.contentRight: IBM and Google are both racing to achieve commercial-grade quantum advantage within the next five years.
